intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Reyson! Are you well?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Tibarn! How did you--

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Nealuchi told us everything.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Oh... Allow me to apologize. I left on my own without a word to you, and this is what happened.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: As long as you're unharmed, all is well. Let's go home.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Please, give me a little time. I cannot allow these humans to remain in the forest.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: I understand how you feel, but we're completely outnumbered. Let us wait for another day--

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Once I stand at the altar, I can take care of them. Every one of them.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: You can't mean... Are you thinking of using the forbidden magic?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: ...Yes. I will sing those monsters the dirge of ruin.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Are you mad?! You mustn't! I can't allow it!

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: With permission or without, I do what I must! It is retribution for genocide! Retribution for this forest!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Reyson! You must not let yourself be ruled by despair! Each member of the heron tribe is an embodiment of balance! Do this, and you warp your very existence!

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: That's what they all said...My family. My tribe. And then...they died. The humans were drunk with joy. They laughed! They sang! ...And then they slaughtered us like livestock. My mother, my brother, my elder sisters... Even my infant sister, Leanne! All killed in a single night.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Reyson...

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: I know. This thing I intend to do brings dishonor to my house. And yet...I cannot forgive. And their past actions weren't enough; now, they violate the sanctity of the forest without a trace of regret! Accursed humans...I will never forgive them!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Don't you think we understand that?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: That's right! Prince Reyson, there's no need for you to reject your honor based on the likes of them!

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: The tragedy of the herons...The horror and pain of that night...lives on in all of us.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Let's return to Phoenicis, and think of a plan. You are right. This will not stand. The full power of the hawk nation is behind you. The humans will pay.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: ...As you wish...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Enough already! Lay down your arms and surrender. We will let you live!

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Grrrrrr... No! Never! I'm not giving up! I'm not finished yet! Out of my way, penniless wretches! Your very existence is an insult to all that is beautiful! All you really want is my wealth and beauty! Miserable curs... You reek of poverty and envy! Oh, but I understand your emotions...Yes, I do. How could you sad vagabonds not want to be me?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...That's the last thing in the world--

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Silence! I am not one to be daunted by mean beggars such as you. Oh ho ho ho! In the name of the goddess, I, Oliver, duke of Tanas, will smite your hideous evil!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Um...

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: To arms! To arms! Defend me with all the strength you possess! Oh, and bring me the little bird that blue-haired lout is carrying while you're at it...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Oh, please.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Here they come! Combat formation, everyone!

battle.speaker: Janaff
battle.line: Uh-oh! They're still going at it over here. Shall we go around?

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: I suppose so. Two human armies bashing one anothers' brains out...I wonder what they're after.

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: There's that sound again. Reyson, are you doing that?

battle.speaker: Reyson
battle.line: ...The forest is whispering something. (What is it?)...What are you trying to tell me?

battle.speaker: Janaff
battle.line: King Tibarn! Prince Reyson! Look! There!

battle.speaker: Janaff
battle.line: The blue-haired human is carrying something on his back...No, it can't be...

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: I think some of the humans might be fighting to protect the heron. Grr... It's against my nature, but...we shall aid them! Janaff! Ulki! To me!

battle.speaker: Reyson
battle.line: Tibarn! (Please....) Allow me to go with you.

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: If you forswear the forbidden magic, you may come.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It's you!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: On your back... Who is it you carry?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh, the girl? I think she may be somebody you know, but...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne!

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: Reyson, my brother?  Brother!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Is it really you, Leanne? This is no dream? How is this possible? How did you survive all this time?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Leanne? Do you know who I am?

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: Tibarn? Of the hawk tribe, yes?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: That's right. You remember my name. Have you been here by yourself for all these years?

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: I don't know...that night... My sisters took me and hid me in the small shrine. I'm sure they sang a galdr to me...And then I became so sleepy...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: The forest protected her. It kept her asleep for so long...There's no way to express my gratitude. Thank you for...With all that I am,  I thank you.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: You there, beorc.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Me?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I am Tibarn, king of Phoenicis. Since the loss of their homeland, the Serenes royal family has been under my guardianship. Who are you, and why do you aid the herons?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: My name is Ike. I am commander of the Greil Mercenaries. I am under orders of the empress, the apostle Sanaki, to protect the herons.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: The empress of this country wants to protect the herons? Ha! That is an interesting tale. The herons were blamed for the assassination of the last empress. They were massacred on hearsay. And now her ancestor wants to help them? Touching.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The empress Sanaki knows that the herons are not murderers. And now, she is trying to atone for the crimes of her people.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: ...No. I cannot believe that.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Pathetic apologies and half-baked platitudes are easily spoken! Humans burned Serenes Forest. They killed my family. I cannot trust one who allies himself with them.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Please, withhold judgment until you speak with the apostle. She's waiting at the forest's edge.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: The apostle is here?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: So you...are the apostle?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I am.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: ...I'm...sorry...I am ignorant as to what words of contrition will be appropriate to one of the heron tribe. Yet I stand before you as a representative of my people... From the depths of my heart I apologize to you... I am sorry... So truly sorry...

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Emp-Empress Sanaki! What are you doing? You are the apostle! You cannot bend your knee to another!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Peace! Let her speak her heart.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I'm sorry...I'm sorry...

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (That is enough...)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne?

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Please rise, Apostle Sanaki.)

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: You... What is it you want? Are you telling me to stand?

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: You...

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (It is enough. It was not your fault.)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne!

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Brother..it is enough, is it not? Forgive this child. Her apology is...so sincere.)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne! You cannot ask me to forgive them! You were asleep... You don't know what these humans did to us...

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (...I do know.  The forests...told me everything.)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: You...know?

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Everyone is...gone, aren't they?)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: That's right... Everyone is gone. That's why I cannot release my hatred.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Brother... My loving brother, Reyson. The pain and sadness is in you, Brother. It clouds your very soul. To see you like this, to watch you. It hurts me. Please...do not lose yourself to hate.)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: (Leanne my sister.) I understand. If that is how you feel...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Apostle Sanaki... We accept your apology. We may not be able to release our hatred of hum-- of beorc, but...You need not let the fate of Serenes Forest trouble you any longer. You are absolved of that guilt......

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Th-thank  you...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That was well done.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Yes...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike, what will happen now?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The heron siblings said there would be some sort of ceremony, but I don't know what that entails.

end.speaker: Janaff
end.line: You there! Beorc mercenaries! Prince Reyson wants all of you to come to the Serenes altar. The presence of Princess Crimea and the apostle is also requested.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Altar?

end.speaker: Janaff
end.line: Just come with me. It's this way.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Empress Sanaki, Commander Sigrun, let us go.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Very well.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Let's hurry, Ike!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Right.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Ah, excellent. The gap between laguz and beorc has been bridged. I think this may be enough...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What's wrong, Soren? You look so grim. What are you looking at?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: It's nothing. Nothing at all.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Wait, Soren! What in the world is wrong with him?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: That was excellent.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It's so beautiful...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: The Serenes Forest, beloved of the goddess, is alive once more.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: You spoke so well earlier, Empress Sanaki. You fill my heart with pride... Sniff...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Here now! None of that. This is no place for tears!

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: I'm sorry... I'm just so happy...

boss.speaker: Oliver
boss.line: Listen to me, you boors! You cannot possibly understand the pursuit of beauty. You are savages! You are a blight on the world, and you must die!

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Commander Ike! A priest from Duke Tanas's villa insists on speaking with you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yes? What is it?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: Um... Master mercenary. It is my understanding that you...you pursue Duke Tanas. I hear that you're searching Serenes Forest in hopes of capturing him.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And if I am?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: Duke Tanas's property borders the forest, and he knows much about its layout. For quite some time now, he's been sending men into the forest to look for any herons who may still live there.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I see... So you're saying that his troops know the forest well.

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: I, too, have been taken into the forest.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You? Why take a priest?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: He thought that herons would make themselves known if a priest called to them. He's also taken dozens of chaste maidens and tried having them call to the herons as well.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But he didn't find any, did he?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: No. And yet, this time...The joy he expressed after paying such an exorbitant price for the Serenes royal was aberrant. It was...not natural. The duke has gone mad. To think that he would dare to defy the apostle...He is damned.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And here you stand. You're going to tell me what you remember about the forest, even though it means you're betraying Tanas...right?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: Hmm... You read me well. To begin with, the heart of the forest was divided into three large sections. Maybe more. It was nearly colorless, and difficult to see far. The muddy floor pulled at our feet, and progress was slow. Many of the soldiers around me were afraid that they didn't bring enough supplies. They said a person would need them if he got lost, because getting out again would be no easy task.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What can you tell me about Duke Tanas's forces?

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: There were a lot of them...He had soldiers of every type. It was said that his mounted units and magic users were especially powerful. So at the very least, you should be prepared to deal with those two groups.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: ...My parents... They both participated in the Serenes massacre. They're nearing the ends of their lives, but even now they lie awake at night and beg the goddess for forgiveness. I became a priest in order to help my parents, but then I was assigned to work at Duke Tanas's villa...I knew of his terrible deeds, but his position as an imperial senator frightened me. I have been silent for far too long. Master mercenary... You must rescue that Serenes youth. I beg of you. May the goddess guide your hand.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Don't worry. I have no intention of letting that villain steal him from before my very eyes.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Here you are.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: We've been in Begnion for a while now. So tell me something...Why are you still here? Are you pretending to be our friend so you can lance us in the back?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: ...You have to understand...I...I didn't know anything. I was born and raised in the Talrega region of Daein. It's a very remote area. My father was a soldier, and I grew up thinking that I, too, would one day be a soldier. A soldier to make my father proud. My life was simple... I questioned nothing. Doubted nothing.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Do you know the first thing we're taught in Daein schools? Sub-humans are evil. Sub-humans are the enemy. Sub-humans must be eradicated. The army stages periodic sub-human hunts. We'd find refugees from Begnion hiding in our mountains and forests...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You participated?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: You don't get it! That's just how things are in Daein! No one taught me the word laguz! No one taught me that sub-humans could be... could be like this. No one cared.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: When I saw the bird tribes at sea, I was convinced that the teachings were true. They were inhuman monsters. But later, I saw the dragons push your ship off of the reef, and it confused me. What if I had been raised to believe a lie? My heart pounded at the thought of it. And my doubts only grew with time.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: So you decided to remain aboard in order to ascertain the truth. That's your true motive, isn't it?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: How did you know?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I've known a lot of soldiers, and none would ever accept charity from an enemy. It would wound their pride. You obviously have pride to spare, so I knew there was some other factor at play.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Oh...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, have you reached a conclusion? What will you do?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: I...want to stay here. At first, I thought I could protect my old life, that I could prove the sub-humans were monsters. But I was wrong. And now things are different. The sub-hu-- I'm sorry, the laguz... I want to know the truth about them, and I need to base that on what I see, not what I am told by others.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: In that case, you can stay as long as you like.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: I appreciate it. I think meeting all of you... was a very good thing.

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: La la la! La la laaaaaa! Hmmmm...La laaaa hmmmmmlaaaaaa!La de di da de laaaaaa...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Um... Hey there, you. Have a minute?

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: Oh, Captain! How are you today?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's commander. Not captain. Well...you seem to be enjoying yourself.

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: That's because this garden is so pretty. Devdan loves all plants and flowers. How about you, Commander?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: They're all right, I suppose.

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: That makes Devdan rather sad. All right is not a very strong feeling. It is boring. You should be a more emotional commander. Even things you're used to will show you something new if you look hard enough. And discoveries are exciting! That's what life is all about! At least, that's what Devdan thinks. Some disagree...and that makes Devdan upset!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...You may be on to something. In Crimea, when my father was still alive, I think I was more open to such things. But now...I just don't have the time. Honestly, all I can think about is defeating Daein. I've no energy left to spend on flowers.

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: ...If you talk like that, you will never defeat Daein.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What did you say?

conversation.speaker: Devdan
conversation.line: The war is new. If you are already so focused on preparations, you'll wear out before the fighting begins.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hold on a minute!...
